medical_history.chief_complaint: Permanent neonatal diabetes diagnosed based on glucosuria and hyperglycemia without ketoacidosis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: In Case 1, diabetes was diagnosed at 3 days of life with hyperglycemia (glucose 16.3 mmol/liter) and undetectable insulin levels. Management has been complicated by severe hypoglycemia. In Case 2, weight loss began at 10 days of age, presenting with dehydration and hyperglycemia (27.3 mmol/liter) at 17 days, also without ketoacidosis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both siblings have required continuous insulin treatment since diagnosis. Developmental delays are noted in Case 1, with overall motor development normal.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes two affected paternal half-siblings but unaffected parents and siblings. No history of gestational diabetes in mothers.
